title: Occupational therapy - Wikipedia
snippet: Occupational therapy (OT), also known as ergotherapy, is a healthcare profession. Ergotherapy is derived from the Greek ergon which is allied to work, to act and to be active.

title: What is OT? / Occupational Therapy Explained - OT Potential
snippet: Jan 8, 2026 · When a health condition makes life difficult, OT is here to help. Occupational therapy (OT) is a healthcare profession that helps people of all ages participate more fully in daily life.

title: Occupational Therapy (OT): Who Needs It, Benefits, What To Expect
snippet: Sep 28, 2025 · Occupational therapy (OT) is a form of rehabilitation therapy that helps you perform daily tasks. It can improve physical, emotional, and social needs.

title: What Is an Occupational Therapist? - WebMD
snippet: Jul 16, 2025 · Occupational therapists have a Master's degree in occupational therapy. Some may also have a doctorate. A Master's degree takes two to three years to finish, and a doctoral degree about …
